info.description: # Get Started Here ðŸ‘‡ The _Postman Visualizer_ provides a programmable way to visually represent your request [responses](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/responses/). ## **Using this collection** This collection contains six sample requests and scripts for rendering Bar graph, Table, Map and visualizing any CSV, JSON or XML data. **Step 1:** Send the sample requests. **Step 2:** Find the visualization in the "visualize" tab in the response near the "Pretty" view. **Step 3:** You can copy, update and use the test script under the "Test" tab for your requests. **Resource:** [Visualizing responses](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/visualizer/#:~:text=as%20an%20object.-,Viewing%20visualizations,be%20in%20a%20web%20browser.)

exec: // Define a handlebars template which will receive the response data and be used to render the visualization
// Create a canvas to draw the chart into
// Import Chart.js library which we'll use to define and draw the chart
// Define the chart axes and appearance using Chart.js
// Get the data passed to the template and apply it to the chart we defined
// Pass our template and response data to the Postman visualizer to render it in the "Visualize" view

request.description:
This request takes random numbers between 0-1000 obtained from the request's response and shows them as a bar chart representing it as imaginary population density for some cities. 

Open the request **Tests** to see how Postman builds the response JSON into the visualizer template.

Try tweaking it by changing to a 'line' or 'pie' chart, then send different data types and visualize them your way!
